column1: Namyangju (Korean pronunciation: [na.mjaŋ.dʑu]) is a city in Gyeonggi Province
column2: South Korea. To the east is Gapyeong County
column3: to the west is Guri City
column4: and to the north is Pocheon City.

column2: also Jeong Yag-yong or Dasan[茶山] (1762–1836)
column3: was a leading Korean philosopher during the Joseon Dynasty. He is widely regarded as the greatest of the Silhak thinkers
column4: who advocated that the formalist Neo-Confucian philosophy of Joseon return to practical concerns. Jeong Yag-yong and his brothers were also among the earliest Korean converts to Roman Catholicism.

column1: Namyangju is a northeastern city which is part of the ring around Seoul. Seoul Ring Expressway passes through.
Jungang Line passes through Namyangju. - Donong station
A refurbished Gyeongchun Line reopened in late 2010 - Byeollae
The Transportation and Construction Committee of the National Assembly has approved that Line 4 will be extended from Danggogae to Jinjeop
The 2012 Munhwa Broadcasting Corporation drama Arang and the Magistrate
column4: were filmed on location in Namyangju.

column1: There are 2 campuses of Gyeong Hee graduate school and Gyeong bok college
The royal tomb of Princess Hwahyeop
column3: was discovered in Sampae-dong in 2015. Excavations in 2016 unearthed stone tablets detailing eulogies to her written by King Yeongjo
column5: and King Jeongjo. Namyangju is also the location of the tomb of Empress Myeongseong.

column1: Namyangju is rapidly developing a reputation as a regional centre of excellence for organic farming. The Namyangju Organic Museum
column2: the world's first museum dedicated to the history and development of organic agriculture
column3: opened in September 2011. It is located west of Seoul and on the shores of the River Han. The museum caters for young and old
column4: it includes a timeline of organic farming developments
column5: and there are exhibits of traditional Korean farming practices tied to the 24 seasonal divisions of the year. The museum's opening coincided with Namyangju hosting the 17th IFOAM Organic World Congress.

column1: Sweet pears grown in Namyangju are exported to the USA
column3: and Canada. Organic vegetables are cultivated with ecofriendly methods.

column1: Gorosoei is a special product made in the Namyangju area. It is medicinal water which has abundant minerals.
The term "Gorosoei" comes from "Gollisu" meaning "water for bones." The sap is extracted at Sudong-Myeon
column2: Mountain Jugeum in Mount Chungnyeong Natural Recreation Forest
column3: Mount Cheonma in Palhyeon and Onam township.
